title: Coin Crypto Price
author: Coin Crypto Price
content: Does anyone know the best way to add a map to the Bitcoin ATM site?Is there any way to add a free one or does it only work by subscription?I want my website visitors to have access to information about Bitcoin ATMs around the world.

comments.author: OmegaStarScream
comments.body: You can get the data from CoinATMRadar. I found this link[1] but apparently, it's deprecated. I couldn't find much on their site about a new API, so I suggest you reach out to them, maybe they can help you.[1] https://www.programmableweb.com/api/coinatmradar-rest-api

comments.author: NeuroticFish
comments.body: Quote from: Coin Crypto Price on September 06, 2022, 07:29:43 AMIs there any way to add a free one or does it only work by subscription?I want my website visitors to have access to information about Bitcoin ATMs around the world.The only information I've found is about "custom integration"Quote from: https://coinatmradar.com/advertising/#operator-mapCustom map integration for your websiteWe provide an iframe integration of bitcoin ATM map for particular operator's locations as a subscription service.I guess that best would be e-mail them (support@coinatmradar.com) and ask.And if the answers you get are not what you'd like (i.e. if it's a paid service), you can look for the (few) competitors, maybe you get lucky.

comments.author: joniboini
comments.body: There is also this one, but I don't know if it is still usable: https://coinmap.org/api/. I think most of these services are running a custom code and don't really want to offer integration for individual users. They target business owner for marketing and stuff like that, so best of luck if you're trying to contact them and ask for a map plugin for your website.

comments.author: DaveF
comments.body: Looking at both those sites I am probably going to say it's not worth the time and effort.There are BATMs that no longer exist that are still listed.There are entire BATM networks that are not listed. (LibertyX comes to mind)Even if you just want to spend crypto, there are stores that no longer exist that are still listed.And so on....These maps seem nice but since they 1st came out with all the other integrations of crypto into other apps they really need a major do-over IMO.As an example, the SPEDN app. You can do crypro -> spend in store to Baskin Robins, Chipolte, Game Stop, Petco, and about 20 more places. No, they do not 'take' crypto but so long as you can put crypto in -> get stuff in the store on the fly does it really matter? Do you want to see all of them listed? Even if you want to support businesses that directly take / support crypto they probably are not doing it themselves but through a 3rd party, be it BitPay, Square (Block) or some other one. Very few that I have seen are doing it internally.Not trying to be a downer, just being a bit realistic for this at the moment. -Dave

comments.author: Coin Crypto Price
comments.body: Thank you all for your opinions and suggestions.
